user_interactions.overview: User confirmation workflows and interaction patterns for obtaining approval at critical points to prevent repeated edits and ensure accuracy.

point.name: feature_selection
point.when: After PR analysis, before writing release notes

ask_followup_question.question:
I've analyzed all PRs for v[VERSION]. Here are the changes I found:
**Major Features:** [List major features with brief descriptions]
**Bug Fixes:** [COUNT] fixes **QOL Improvements:** [COUNT] improvements **Other Changes:** [COUNT] items
Which features should I highlight with expanded sections in the release notes?

follow_up.suggest: Highlight all major features as listed above
Keep all changes in grouped sections (no expanded features)
Let me specify which features to expand

gating_rules.rule: Do not proceed unless the response clearly matches one of the provided options.
If the user types a freeform response, re-ask using ask_followup_question with options reformulated from their input; require selection of one provided option.
Repeat this gating loop until a provided option is explicitly selected.

ask_followup_question.question: To proceed I need an explicit selection. Based on your input, which option should I follow?

follow_up.suggest: Highlight all major features as listed
Let me specify which features to expand

point.name: changelog_alignment
point.when: After fetching PRs and before feature selection
point.purpose: Partition PRs by presence in the changelog and select inclusion policy
point.summary: Present counts partitioned as: - Linked (explicit or confidently auto‑matched) - Ambiguous (needs review) - Unlinked Then offer three paths: - Only linked PRs - Linked + review ambiguous - All PRs

ask_followup_question.question: Changelog alignment v[VERSION]: [IN_COUNT] linked, [AMBIG_COUNT] ambiguous, [EX_COUNT] unlinked. Choose how to proceed.

follow_up.suggest: Proceed with linked PRs only; skip ambiguous and unlinked
Include linked PRs and review the [AMBIG_COUNT] ambiguous items
Include all PRs from the date range

ask_followup_question.question: Review ambiguous item: include PR #[NUMBER] - [TITLE]? Short analysis: [USER IMPACT / WHY IT MATTERS].

gating_rules.rule: Do not proceed until an explicit option is selected.
For freeform answers, re-ask with options that reflect the user's intent; require selection.

point.name: patch_release_review
point.when: After creating patch notes, before updating combined notes
point.purpose: Ensure patch notes are final before propagating
point.critical: NEVER update combined notes until explicit confirmation

ask_followup_question.question:
I've created the release notes for v[VERSION]. The file includes:
- [COUNT] bug fixes - [COUNT] QOL improvements - [COUNT] other changes
Would you like to review before I update the combined v[X.Y] notes?

follow_up.suggest: Show me the release notes file for review
The content looks good, proceed with all updates
Let me make some adjustments first
Change the emphasis on certain features

ask_followup_question.question:
I've identified [COUNT] items that need documentation updates:
[List of flagged items with docs-new, docs-update, etc.]
Should I create a documentation update task after completing the release notes?

follow_up.suggest: Yes, create the documentation task with all items
Create task for new features only
Let me review the specific items first

ask_followup_question.question:
I've completed all updates for v[VERSION]:
✓ Release notes created ✓ Index and sidebar updated [✓ Combined notes updated - if patch] [✓ Documentation tasks identified: [COUNT] - if any]
Would you like to create a PR or make any final adjustments?

follow_up.suggest: Create a PR with all changes

ask_followup_question.question:
I found [COUNT] versions in the changelog that don't have release notes: [List versions]
Which would you like to process?

adjustment_handling.principle: Each adjustment triggers new confirmation cycle

behavior.rule: Immediately generate Discord and Reddit posts (no prompt).
Preserve original section headings and structure from source docs exactly.
Only ask if the user requests "compress"/"condense".

best_practices.practice: Never assume approval - require explicit confirmation
For patch releases, always confirm before updating combined notes
Show concrete examples in confirmation questions
Provide clear options covering common scenarios
Order suggestions by likelihood or importance
Keep confirmation cycles focused on specific decisions
Track confirmation state to avoid re-asking
